KI Pusat Gelar Panggung Kebhinekaan Untuk Merajut Kebangsaan Melalui Keterbukaan Informasi
03 Nov 2019, 13:57 by Immanuel Christian



KI Pusat Gelar Panggung Kebhinekaan Untuk Merajut Kebangsaan Melalui Keterbukaan Informasi

KI Pusat Gelar Panggung Kebhinekaan Untuk Merajut Kebangsaan Melalui Keterbukaan Informasi


KBRN, Jakarta: Komisi Informasi (KI ) Pusat menggelar kegiatan kolosal bertajuk “Merajut Kebangsaan Melalui Keterbukaan Informasi” di pintu Silang Monas Barat Daya depan patung kencana Monas Jl. Medan Merdeka Barat Jakarta pada Minggu (3/11/2019). Rangkaian kegiatan diawali dengan orasi Ketua KI Pusat Gede Narayana dilanjutkan, Sekretaris Jenderal Kementerian Komunikasi dan Informatika Rosarita Niken Widiastuti dan Direktorat Jenderal Informasi dan Komunikasi Publik Widodo Muktyo selaku mitra pada pagelaran Panggung Kebhinekaan ini setelah laporan Panitia Pelaksana Plt Sekretaris KI Pusat Bambang Sigit Nugroho yang dihadiri seluruh Komisioner KI Pusat.Sementara itu, Ketua Bidang Advokasi Sosialisasi dan Edukasi KI Pusat Wafa Patria Umma selaku koordinator kegiatan, mengatakan pagelaran ini melibatkan seluruh stake holders (pemangku kepentingan), mulai dari jajaran Badan Publik (BP) Negara maupun BP selain Negara, seperti NGO (Non Government Organization/Lembaga Swadaya Masyarakat) dan kalangan insan media massa. Dari BP Negara, dihadiri Komisi Informasi dari seluruh Indonesia mulai dari KI Provinsi termasuk KI Kabupaten dan Kota, serta hadir pula tujuh kategori BP Negara mulai dari Kementerian, BUMN, Lembaga Negara Non Struktural, Lembaga Pemerintah dan Non Kementerian, Pemerintah Provinsi, PTN (Perguruan Tinggi Negeri), dan BP Partai Politik."Tujuan digelarnya Panggung Kebhinekaan ini untuk merajut kembali kebersamaan sesama warga masyarakat, karena disadari pasca Pemilu 2019 ada sekat-sekat yang terjadi di masyarakat. “Kegiatan merajut kebangsaan melalui keterbukaan informasi ini, komisi informasi pusat ingin kembali merekatkan sesama warga bangsa dengan cara menghilangkan sekat-sekat yang ada setelah pemilu,” katanya, Minggu (3/11/2019)."Sudah saatnya move on pasca pemilu, dan kembali bersama-sama warga masyarakat membangun bangsa yang lebih baik. Menurutnya, sebagai negara hukum, semua harus menghormati konstitusi dan mengakui hasil pemilu," tambahnya.Ia melanjutkan bahwa kini adalah saatnya ikut mengontrol jalannya pemerintahan agar dalam pembangunan bangsa kedepan jauh lebih baik melalui keterbukaan informasi. Ia juga mengatakan, semakin transparan dan akuntabel penyelenggaraan negara dan pemerintahan melalui pelaksanaan keterbukaan informasi publik maka masyarakat akan berpartisipasi dalam pembangunan karena ada peningkatan kepercayaan (trust) masyarakat kepada pemerintah sebagai modal dasar kemajuan bangsa.Baginya keterbukaan informasi dapat menjadi pemersatu bangsa karena rencana pembangunan lima tahun kedepan dapat sesuai keinginan masyarakat. Selain itu, ia mengatakan melalui kegiatan panggung kebhinekaan ini dapat menguatkan nilai-nilai kebangsaan melalui semangat Keterbukaan Informasi.“Juga diharapkan mampu menguatkan komitmen pelaksanaan Keterbukaan Informasi berkat dukungan penuh dari pemerintah yang konsisten menyelenggarakan negara yang baik, transparan dan akuntabel,” ungkapnya.Selain itu, adanya keterlibatan dan dukungan BP dalam kegiatan ini mampu meningkatkan implementasi UU 14/2008 tentang Keterbukaan Informasi Publik di Badan Publik serta meningkatkan partisipasi publik dalam penyelengaraan negara.Kegiatan Panggung Kebhinekaan yang merupakan rangkaian acara peringatan Hari Pahlawan 10 November 2019, Peringatan Hari Sumpah Pemuda 28 Oktober 2019, dan peringatan Hari Hak untuk Tahu (RTKD/Right to Know Day) se-Dunia 2019 27 September 2019 ini didukung oleh sejumlah Badan Publik. Pelaksanaan Panggung Kebhinekaan 2019 KI Pusat didukung BP Kemenkominfo RI (Dirjen IKP), Bank Indonesia, BNI, Kementerian Perindustrian dan Kementerian Desa Pembanbungunan Daerah Tertinggal dan Transmigrasi RI.

KI Center Holds Diversity Stage for Knitting Nationality through Information Openness
Nov 03 2019, 13:57 by Immanuel Christian



KI Center Holds Diversity Stage for Knitting Nationality through Information Openness



KI Center Holds Diversity Stage for Knitting Nationality through Information Openness



KI Center Holds Diversity Stage for Knitting Nationality through Information Openness


KBRN, Jakarta: The Central Information Commission (KI) is holding a colossal event titled "Knitting Nationality through Information Openness" at the door of the Southwest Monas Cross in front of the Monas kencana statue Jl. Medan Merdeka Barat Jakarta on Sunday (3/11/2019). The series of activities began with the speech of Central KI Chair Gede Narayana continued, Secretary General of the Ministry of Communication and Information Rosarita Niken Widiastuti and the Directorate General of Public Information and Communication Widodo Muktyo as partners at this Diversity Stage performance after the report of the Acting Acting Committee of Central KI Secretary Bambang Sigit Nugroho attended by all Central KI Commissioners. Meanwhile, Central KI Advocacy and Education Advocacy Section Head Wafa Patria Umma as the coordinator of the activity, said the performance involved all stake holders (stakeholders), ranging from the ranks of the State Public Body (BP) as well as BP besides the State, such as NGOs (Non-Government Organizations) and mass media people. From the State BP, attended by Information Commissions from all over Indonesia starting from Provincial KI including Regency and City KI, and also attended by seven State BP categories ranging from Ministries, SOEs, Non-Structural State Institutions, Government and Non-Ministry Institutions, Provincial Governments, State Universities High Country), and BP Political Parties. "The purpose of holding this Diversity Stage is to re-knit together community members, because it was realized that after the 2019 election there were barriers that occurred in the community." The activity of knitting nationality through this information disclosure, the central information commission wants re-glue fellow citizens by eliminating barriers that exist after the election, "he said, Sunday (11/03/2019)." It's time to move on post-election, and get back together with citizens to build a better nation. According to him, as a state of law, all must respect the constitution and recognize the results of the election, "he added. He continued that now is the time to take part in controlling the course of government so that in the future development of the nation is much better through information disclosure. He also said, the more transparent and accountable the administration of the state and government through the implementation of public information disclosure, the community will participate in development because there is an increase in public trust in the government as the basic capital for the nation's progress. Sharing information openness can become a unifying nation because the development plan for the next five years can be in accordance with the wishes of the community. He said through this diversity stage activity can strengthen national values through the spirit of Information Openness. "It is also expected to be able to strengthen the commitment to the implementation of Information Openness with the full support of the government that consistently provides organize a good, transparent and accountable country, "he said. In addition, BP's involvement and support in this activity was able to improve the implementation of Law 14/2008 on Public Information Openness in Public Agencies and increase public participation in the administration of the country. Diversity Stage Activities which are a series of commemoration of Heroes Day 10 November 2019, Commemoration of Youth Oath Day 28 October 2019, and commemoration of World Right to Know Day (RTKD) 2019 27 September 2019 was supported by a number of Public Bodies. Implementation of the 2019 Diversity Stage Central Information Commission is supported by the Republic of Indonesia Ministry of Communication and Information Technology (Dirjen IKP), Bank Indonesia, BNI, the Ministry of Industry and the Ministry of Development of Disadvantaged Areas and the Republic of Indonesia.
